resources.string: Download large files(> 20MB) faster using Wi-Fi and 4G/3G networks together. The Turbo Download icon will show on the status bar when Turbo is running. To use Turbo Download, Wi-Fi and Mobile data must both be on. When enabled, any application data selected for download via Wi-Fi only will be downloaded via WLAN and 4G/3G networks.
Either Mobile or Wi-Fi is OFF.
Wi-Fi and Mobile data must both be ON to enable Turbo Download.
Downloading via a mobile network may result in additional charges.
Vpn is ON. Turbo Download is OFF.
Wi-Fi/Mobile data speed is slow. To speed up the download, Turbo download will only use Wi-Fi/mobile data to download files.
Turbo download uses Wi-Fi and mobile data together to download files.

"

Turbo Download Help\


Download large files at top speed by using Wi-Fi and 4G/3G at the same time.\

1. Go to Settings and tap Turbo Download.

\

2. Tap the switch to turn on Turbo Download.

\

[Tip] To increase speed when connected to both Wi-Fi and 4G/3G when starting to download.\

[Tip] If a Wi-Fi or 4G/3G connection is too slow use this faster network connection for downloading.\

[Tip] The network environment may affect the speed and performance of Turbo Download.\
  - An unstable signal will affect the speed and performance of this feature.\
  - however, on average, the download speed will be twice that of Wi-Fi or 4G/3G when used alone.\

[Tip] Should the difference in speed between Wi-Fi and 4G/3G become large (normal is 2.5 times), Turbo Download will stop to avoid degrade of speed.\

[Tip] Turbo Download will be disabled automatically if Tethering/Vpn is turned on.\ "
